de.tschebbischeff.math

Class Quat4d

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tschebbischeff.math.Quat4d

  • public class Quat4d
extends java.lang.Object
    Quaternion implementation with double precision.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Tarek

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private double[] data
      Stores the quaternion data in a 4 element array
      private static double UNITY_BOUND_HI
      The upper bound determining unity of the quaternion, if the length of the quaternion is above this threshold it is not considered a unit quaternion anymore.
      private static double UNITY_BOUND_LO
      The lower bound determining unity of the quaternion, if the length of the quaternion is below this threshold it is not considered a unit quaternion anymore.
      private static double UNITY_FACTOR
      Factor defining, when the quaternion is considered to not be a unit quaternion anymore.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Quat4d(double[] v) 
      Quat4d(double roll, double pitch, double yaw)
      Creates a quaternion that rolls pitches and yaws
      Quat4d(double w, double i, double j, double k) 
      Quat4d(double real, Vector3d imaginary) 
      Quat4d(Vector3d x, Vector3d y)
      Creates a quaternion representing the rotation from one vector to another.

        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Quat4d

        public Quat4d(double roll,
              double pitch,
              double yaw)
        Creates a quaternion that rolls pitches and yaws
        Parameters:
        roll - The roll represented by the quaternion.
        pitch - The pitch represented by the quaternion.
        yaw - The yaw represented by the quaternion.

      • Quat4d

        public Quat4d(Vector3d x,
              Vector3d y)
        Creates a quaternion representing the rotation from one vector to another.
        Parameters:
        x - The vector which is rotated by the resulting quaternion to obtain y.
        y - The vector that is the result of x's rotation by the resulting quaternion.
